definition: lit. lovely scene of blossoming plants swaying in the breeze (idiom)/fig. gorgeously dressed (woman)
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
surname Hua
branch/classifier for sticks, rods, pencils etc

surname Zhan

sentences.english: She dresses up fit to kill even to go out shopping.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至出外購物，也打扮得花枝招展。
她總是打扮得花枝招展。

sentences.english: She doesn't love dressing up, this makes her in beautiful, very thin.
sentences.chinese: 她不愛打扮，這又使她在花枝招展中，格外單薄。

sentences.english: She likes get gussied up and goes to a dancing patty.
sentences.chinese: 她喜歡打扮得花枝招展的去參加舞會。

sentences.english: I am wearing simple dress everyday, stand in be gorgeously dressed among them.
sentences.chinese: 我每天穿着樸素的衣服，站在花枝招展的她們中間。

sentences.english: She dolled herself up as though she was a girl of eighteen.
sentences.chinese: 她打扮得花枝招展，好像是個十八歲的姑娘似的。

sentences.english: It does not have to be pretty to be beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 美並不一定是要花枝招展。

sentences.english: She is well dressed up but nowhere to go .
sentences.chinese: 她打扮得花枝招展，卻無處可去。
